lesson.title: Addition and Subtraction
objectives: Develop number sense through addition and subtraction
Enhance problem-solving skills with word problems
lesson.overview: This lesson focuses on building number sense through addition and subtraction, using both computation and word problems to enhance problem-solving skills.

introduction.description: Introduce addition and subtraction concepts with examples on the whiteboard.
instructions: Explain how to line up numbers by place value for addition and subtraction.
Demonstrate solving word problems by identifying key information.

activity.description: Students practice addition and subtraction through computation problems and word problems.
instructions: Complete the problems on the worksheet.
Use strategies discussed in class to solve word problems.

teacherIntroduction.script: Today, we are going to practice addition and subtraction. Remember to line up your numbers by place value. For word problems, read carefully and underline what the problem is asking.

whiteboardExamples.solution: First, add the ones: 3 + 5 = 8. Then add the tens: 2 + 1 = 3. The answer is 38.
First, subtract the ones: 1 - 9 (borrow to make 11 - 9 = 2). Then subtract the tens: 3 - 1 = 2. The answer is 22.

studentProblems.problem: John has 23 apples. He buys 12 more. How many apples does he have now?
Lisa has 40 candies. She gives 15 to her friend. How many candies does she have left?

worksheet.title: Addition and Subtraction Practice
worksheet.instructions: Solve the following problems using the strategies we discussed.

items.content: Solve 12 + 7. Add the ones: 2 + 7 = 9. Add the tens: 1 + 0 = 1. The answer is 19.
Solve 29 - 14. Subtract the ones: 9 - 4 = 5. Subtract the tens: 2 - 1 = 1. The answer is 15.

sections.title: Activity
sections.instructions: Solve each of the problems below.

items.content: Tom has 10 marbles. He finds 8 more. How many does he have now?
Sarah has 22 stickers. She gives 5 to her friend. How many does she have left?
What is 26 + 15?
What is 37 - 21?
If you have 50 candies and eat 23, how many are left?
You have 60 apples, and you give 15 away. How many apples do you have?
If you add 7 and 8, you get ___
Subtracting 10 from 25 gives you ___

accommodations: Provide visual aids for problem solving

worksheet.title: Addition and Subtraction Practice
worksheet.instructions: Solve the following problems using the strategies we discussed.

items.content: Solve 12 + 7. Add the ones: 2 + 7 = 9. Add the tens: 1 + 0 = 1. The answer is 19.
Solve 29 - 14. Subtract the ones: 9 - 4 = 5. Subtract the tens: 2 - 1 = 1. The answer is 15.

sections.title: Activity
sections.instructions: Solve each of the problems below.

items.content: Tom has 10 marbles. He finds 8 more. How many does he have now?
Sarah has 22 stickers. She gives 5 to her friend. How many does she have left?
What is 26 + 15?
What is 37 - 21?
If you have 50 candies and eat 23, how many are left?
You have 60 apples, and you give 15 away. How many apples do you have?
If you add 7 and 8, you get ___
Subtracting 10 from 25 gives you ___

accommodations: Provide visual aids for problem solving

worksheet.title: Advanced Addition and Subtraction
worksheet.instructions: Solve the following problems using the strategies we discussed.

items.content: Solve 125 + 78. Add the ones: 5 + 8 = 13, write 3 and carry over 1. Add the tens: 2 + 7 = 9, plus 1 = 10, write 0 and carry over 1. Add the hundreds: 1 + 1 = 2. The answer is 203.
Solve 234 - 89. Subtract the ones: 4 - 9 (borrow to make 14 - 9 = 5). Subtract the tens: 2 - 8 (borrow to make 12 - 8 = 4). Subtract the hundreds: 1 - 0 = 1. The answer is 145.

sections.title: Activity
sections.instructions: Solve each of the problems below.

items.content: A farmer has 150 chickens. He buys 75 more. How many chickens does he have now?
A library has 600 books. 245 are borrowed. How many books are left?
What is 567 + 298?
What is 763 - 482?
If you have 800 candies and give 350 away, how many are left?
You have 950 apples, and you give 400 away. How many apples do you have?
Add 123 and 456 to get ___
Subtracting 298 from 500 gives you ___

accommodations: Provide step-by-step guides for complex problems
